description: Ontology for PREMIS 3, the international standard for metadata to support the preservation of digital objects and ensure their long-term usability.

Action.label: Action
Action.description: Operation type to perform on an Object. Effectively performing this action may produce an Event.

Agent.label: Agent
Agent.description: Actor (human, machine, or software) associated with one or more Event and/or Rights      statement associated with a digital object.

Bitstream.label: Bitstream
Bitstream.description: Contiguous or non-contiguous data within a file that has meaningful properties for      preservation purposes.

Dependency.label: Dependency
Dependency.description: Relationship where one Object requires another Object to support its function, delivery, or      the coherence of its content.

EnvironmentCharacteristic.label: Environment characteristic
EnvironmentCharacteristic.description: An assessment of the extent to which the described environment supports its      purpose.

Event.label: Event
Event.description: Action performed within or outside the repository that affects its capability to preserve Objects over the long term.

File.label: File
File.description: Named and ordered sequence of bytes that is known to an operating system.

Fixity.label: Fixity
Fixity.description: Information used to verify whether an object has been altered in an undocumented or      unauthorized way.

Identifier.label: Identifier
Identifier.description: An unambiguous reference to the PREMIS entity within the preservation      repository.

Inhibitor.label: Inhibitor
Inhibitor.description: Feature of a Digital Object intended to inhibit access, copying, dissemination, or      migration. Common Inhibitors are encryption and password protection.

InstitutionalPolicy.label: Institutional policy
InstitutionalPolicy.description: A policy decision made by an organization.

IntellectualEntity.label: Intellectual entity
IntellectualEntity.description: A set of content that is considered a single intellectual unit for purposes of management and      description: for example, a particular book, map, photograph, database, or piece of hardware or      software. An Intellectual Entity can include other Intellectual Entities; for example, a web site can      include a web page; a web page can include an image. An Intellectual Entity may have one or more digital      representations. An Intellectual Entity may also describe an environment, defined as technology      supporting a digital object in some way (e.g. by rendering or executing it). Environments can consist of      software, hardware, or a combination of both.

License.label: License
License.description: A license agreement or other legal document that grants rights.

Object.label: Object
Object.description: Discrete unit of information subject to digital preservation. Subclasses of Object are      Intellectual Entity, Representation, File and Bitstream.

OutcomeStatus.label: Outcome status
OutcomeStatus.description: Overall result of the Event in terms of success, partial success, or failure.

PreservationPolicy.label: Preservation policy
PreservationPolicy.description: Information indicating the decision or policy on the set of preservation functions to be      applied to an object and the context in which the decision or policy was made. Note that in addition to      subclasses declared at presLevType, SignificantProperties is also a subclass of PreservationPolicy.      Implementers may also wish to create locally-defined subclasses.

Representation.label: Representation
Representation.description: Digital or physical Object instantiating or embodying an Intellectual Entity. A digital      representation is the set of stored digital files and structural metadata needed to provide a complete      and reasonable rendition of the Intellectual Entity. A physical representation is an item such as a      manuscript, video cassette, or printed document.

RightsBasis.label: Rights basis
RightsBasis.description: Designation of the basis for the right or permission governing the Object.

RightsStatus.label: Rights status
RightsStatus.description: Information about how a RightsBasis applies to a particular object.

Rule.label: Rule
Rule.description: Statement about the Actions an Agent is permitted to undertake or prohibited from      undertaking with respect to an Object.

Signature.label: Signature
Signature.description: Mathematical technique used to validate the authenticity and integrity of a message,      software or digital document.

SignatureEncoding.label: Signature encoding
SignatureEncoding.description: Encoding used for the signature value and key information.

SignificantProperties.label: Significant properties
SignificantProperties.description: Characteristics of a particular object subjectively determined to be important to maintain      through preservation actions.

Statute.label: Statute
Statute.description: A law that grants or revokes rights, such as laws governing privacy or orphan      works.

StorageLocation.label: Storage location
StorageLocation.description: Information needed to retrieve a physical item from its physical storage location or a file      from the storage system, or to access a bitstream within a file.

StorageMedium.label: Storage medium
StorageMedium.description: The physical medium on which the Object is stored (e.g., magnetic tape, hard disk, CD-ROM,      DVD).

basis.label: has basis
basis.description: Links from a RightsStatus to the RightsBasis instance that supports or documents      it.

version.label: has version
version.domain: http://purl.org/dc/terms/FileFormat or premis:HardwareAgent or premis:IntellectualEntity or premis:SoftwareAgent
